required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Predict the Benefits of First-line Humidification Use and Comparison of the Effect of ThermoSmart™ and no Humidification on Adherence
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Advantages Linked to the Use of Humidification by ThermoSmart During Continuous Positive Airway Pressure

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to investigate the benefits of using first line heated humidification. The primary objective of this research is to determine the effect of high levels of humidification delivered by ThermoSmart™ on CPAP adherence. In addition, to determine if it is possible to predict which patients benefit the most (i.e. be more adherent with therapy) from high levels of humidification delivered by ThermoSmart.

primary_outcome.description: Adherence with treatment per night averaged over total time period measured via internal software on the CPAP device and reported using InfoSmart™ software. The report will include all the supporting information recorded within the CPAP device.

secondary_outcome.description: Subjective measure of daytime sleepiness. There are 8 questions where the patient picks a scale of 0 = would never doze to 3 = high level of dozing for each questions. There can be a total score of 24. A score of 0-10 indicates normal daytime sleepiness, 11-12 mild excessive daytime sleepiness, 13-15 moderate excessive daytime sleepiness and 16-24 is severe excessive daytime sleepiness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Short Functional Outcomes of Sleep Questionnaire (FOSQ-10)
secondary_outcome.description: Collected through the Short Functional Outcomes of Sleep Questionnaire (FOSQ-10). The questionnaire has 10 questions which ask how daytime sleepiness has impacted their quality of life. Each question has a scale of 1 = yes extreme to 4 = No. Lower total score (min 10) means that the disease is affecting your quality of life while a higher total score (maximum 40) means that the disease is not affecting your quality of life.

Measured through a visual analog scale. The patient has to mark a cross on the scale to indicate the severity of their symptoms. On the left side of the scale has "not at all" and on the right side of the scale has "extremely", In order to analyze the data, a ruler from the start of the scale (Left side) to the middle of the cross is measured in cm. The total length of the scale is 14 cm. Therefore, the minimum score is 0 and the maximum score is 14. The higher the score means that the participant is experiencing more symptoms.

Measured through a visual analog scale. The patient has to mark a cross on the scale to indicate the severity of their symptoms. On the left side of the scale has "not at all" and on the right side of the scale has "extremely", In order to analyze the data, a ruler from the start of the scale (Left side) to the middle of the cross is measured in cm. The total length of the scale is 14 cm. Therefore, the minimum score is 0 and the maximum score is 14. The higher the score means that the participant is experiencing more symptoms.

Measured through a visual analog scale. The patient has to mark a cross on the scale to indicate the severity of their symptoms. On the left side of the scale has "not at all" and on the right side of the scale has "extremely", In order to analyze the data, a ruler from the start of the scale (Left side) to the middle of the cross is measured in cm. The total length of the scale is 14 cm. Therefore, the minimum score is 0 and the maximum score is 14. The higher the score means that the participant is experiencing more symptoms.
Through a questionnaire, the participant is asked to picked rather they prefer treatment A (No ThermoSmart) or treatment B (ThermoSmart). If they did not pick neither, it is considered no preference.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Older than 18 years of age
- Diagnosed with OSA and eligible for CPAP treatment under local requirements (AHI>30 or if AHI is lower than 30, at least 10 micro arousals identified during diagnosis PSG).
- Naïve to CPAP therapy, i.e have not been prescribed, or used CPAP in the last 5 years
- Patients receiving social security coverage (excluding MEAs)
- Fluent spoken and written French
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe heart disease
- Co-existing lung disease
- Co-existing sleep disorder
- Pregnant
- Refused participation

group.title: Thermosmart On, Then Followed by ThermoSmart Off
group.description: Subjects receive heated humidification (ThermoSmart) first, then followed by it off.

group.title: ThermoSmart Off, Then Followed by ThermoSmart On
group.description: Subjects receive dry CPAP/APAP (no ThermoSmart), then followed by it on.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: All Participants as this is a crossover trial where participant will experience both heated humidification (ThermoSmart On) or dry CPAP/APAP (ThermoSmart Off)

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Adherence
outcome.description: Adherence with treatment per night averaged over total time period measured via internal software on the CPAP device and reported using InfoSmart™ software. The report will include all the supporting information recorded within the CPAP device.

group.description: Subjects receive heated humidification Heated humidification (ThermoSmart): Heated Humidification (ThermoSmart) Turned On

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
